overview.what_is_ich: The International Council for Harmonisation (ICH) is a global initiative that brings together regulatory authorities and pharmaceutical industry representatives to develop harmonized guidelines for safe, effective, and high-quality medicines.
overview.mission: To achieve global harmonization for the development, registration, and post-market surveillance of medicines, ensuring safety, efficacy, and quality while optimizing resources.

Quality.description: Focuses on technical aspects of drug substance, product, manufacturing, and quality control to ensure consistent quality.

Q1.name: Stability Testing

sub_guidelines.Q1A(R2): Stability testing of new drug substances and products

Q1.purpose: Ensures drugs remain effective and safe during storage.
Q1.use: Used in stability studies for regulatory submissions to determine shelf life and storage conditions.

Q2.name: Analytical Validation
Q2.purpose: Provides guidance on validating analytical methods for accuracy, precision, and specificity.
Q2.use: Ensures reliable and reproducible analytical methods for quality control.

Q3.name: Impurities
Q3.purpose: Controls impurities in drug substances and products to ensure safety.
Q3.use: Identifies, quantifies, and controls impurities, including degradation products.

Q8.name: Pharmaceutical Development
Q8.purpose: Promotes a scientific and risk-based approach to drug development.
Q8.use: Designs robust manufacturing processes and ensures consistent drug quality.

Q9.name: Quality Risk Management
Q9.purpose: Provides tools for risk identification, assessment, and mitigation.
Q9.use: Manages risks in manufacturing and quality control processes.

Q10.name: Pharmaceutical Quality System
Q10.purpose: Establishes a quality management system for the drug lifecycle.
Q10.use: Ensures consistent quality throughout development and manufacturing.

Q11.name: Development and Manufacture of Drug Substances
Q11.purpose: Guidance for chemical and biotechnological drug substances.
Q11.use: Supports development of robust drug substances.

Q12.name: Lifecycle Management
Q12.use: Facilitates regulatory flexibility for post-approval changes.

Q14.name: Analytical Procedure Development
Q14.purpose: Complements Q2 for analytical method development.

Safety.description: Focuses on non-clinical safety studies to assess risks like toxicity and carcinogenicity.

S2.name: Genotoxicity Testing
S2.use: Ensures drugs are safe from genotoxic risks.

S5.name: Reproductive Toxicology

sub_guidelines.S5(R3): Detection of reproductive and developmental toxicity

S5.purpose: Assesses effects on reproduction and development.
S5.use: Ensures drug safety for reproductive health.

Efficacy.description: Covers design, conduct, safety, and reporting of clinical trials.

E2.name: Pharmacovigilance

sub_guidelines.E2B(R3): Electronic transmission of adverse event reports

E2.purpose: Manages adverse event reporting and safety monitoring.
E2.use: Ensures ongoing safety in clinical trials and post-market.

E6.name: Good Clinical Practice
E6.purpose: Ethical and scientific standards for clinical trials.
E6.use: Ensures trial integrity and patient safety.

E8.name: General Considerations for Clinical Trials
E8.purpose: Provides principles for clinical trial design.
E8.use: Ensures robust and scientific trial designs.

E9.name: Statistical Principles for Clinical Trials
E9.purpose: Guides statistical methods in clinical trials.

Multidisciplinary.description: Covers cross-cutting topics like regulatory submissions and terminology.

M1.name: MedDRA Terminology
M1.purpose: Standardized medical terminology for regulatory communication.

M7.name: Mutagenic Impurities

sub_guidelines.M7(R2): Assessment and control of mutagenic impurities

M7.use: Ensures drug safety from mutagenic risks.

query_examples.get_category: Access guidelines[category] for all guidelines in a category (e.g., Quality).
